**Final Paragraph:**
"Prehistory is the time before people started writing things down, so we call it 'before history'. It started when humans first appeared on Earth, about 3 million years ago, and ended when people in different parts of the world began writing about their lives. This time period is very important because it helps us understand how humans lived and how they changed over thousands of years. We learn about this time by studying things like tools, art, and buildings that people made, as well as bones and plants they used. This is called archaeology."

Prehistory is the time before written history. It started about 3.3 million years ago and ended around 3,300 years ago. During this time, humans didn't keep written records. Instead, we learn about it through fossils, art, and tools. Archaeologists study these to understand how people lived and changed over time. Prehistory is divided into three main periods: the Stone Age, Bronze Age, and Iron Age.

Prehistory is the time before written history. It began when the first humans appeared and ended when people started writing things down. This period is very important for understanding how humans lived and evolved. Archaeologists study it by looking at old tools, bones, and other remains. This helps them learn about early human cultures and how they changed over time. Prehistory is divided into different periods based on the tools people used. The most famous is the Stone Age, which is split into the Paleolithic (Old Stone Age) and Neolithic (New Stone Age). Each period shows how humans adapted to their environments and invented new technologies.
